intro: Adenophora pichleri, commonly known as the Pichler's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of blue to purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Adenophora pichleri is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
